intro: Centropogon exasperatus, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in wet, tropical environments and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage is lance-shaped and often has a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are known for their rapid blooming and closing behavior in response to environmental changes. Centropogon exasperatus is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
